page.title: 09Yetholm Clubs
page.content: Yetholm, has a vibrant, active community with thirty clubs or societies for all ages. Clubs meet in the school, the Wauchope Hall, the Scout Hut or the pavilion. The Social Club, formed in 1980 meets monthly from October to March with a membership of 150. Good management ensures the presence of Scotlands top country and western and folk music performers. The ladies support the Rural and Guild, the leek and flower show clubs provide keen male intrest, and both support the badminton. The Youngsters attend cubs, brownies and guides. Football and cricket teams play in organised leagues but are forced to import players. Festival and Spittal Trip are highlights in a busy summer.All clubs are self supporting and a feature of village life. The Mission hold two meetings a week.
